text: Adolfo Pérez Esquivel (born November 26, 1931) is an Argentine activist, community organizer, art painter, writer and sculptor. He was the recipient of the 1980 Nobel Peace Prize for his criticism of the Argentina's last civil- military dictatorship (1976-1983). He was detained, tortured, and held without trial for 14 months; during that period he also received, among other distinctions, the Pope John XXIII Peace Memorial. ==References== ==Other websites== * Adolfo Pérez Esquivel official site, edited by Juan Varni * (English, French, Spanish, Portuguese) * 'The Military Did Not Do It Alone'- a video interview with Adolfo Pérez Esquivel * Category:1931 births Category:Living people Category:Argentine painters Category:Argentine sculptors Category:Writers from Buenos Aires Category:Politicians from Buenos Aires Category:Argentine human rights activists Category:Nobel Peace Prize winners Category:Nonviolence advocates Category:Torture victims
